Against: Al-Ma'rouf and Al-Narjis Joint Company for General Trading <orig>شركة المعروف والنرجس المشتركة للتجارة العامة</orig>.

Head of the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>رئيس إدارة الإفلاس</orig>
In the name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>
Decision

On Sunday, 15/6/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, with the membership of Mr. Zaid Abdul Hadi Al-Attar <orig>زيد عبد الهادي العطار</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, and in the presence of Mr. Khaled Abdullah Al-Qubaisi <orig>خالد عبد الله القبيسي</orig>, Secretary <orig>أمين السر</orig>.
In Application No. (1/2024 Restructuring)
Registered under Automated No. 241562490
Submitted by: Al-Mishtereka Group for Contracting Company <orig>شركة المجموعة المشتركة للمقاولات</orig>
Against: Al-Ma'rouf and Al-Narjis Joint Company for General Trading <orig>شركة المعروف والنرجس المشتركة للتجارة العامة</orig>
Having reviewed the documents and the memorandum of Nour Faisal Jassem Al-Narjis <orig>نور فيصل جاسم النرجس</orig> requesting the appointment of an inspector, and in accordance with the provisions of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> and its executive regulations:
The facts are established in what was encompassed by the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> in the present application, issued on 18/11/2024, to which we refer to avoid repetition.
Whereas, as stipulated in Article 1 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, "The Inspector <orig>المفتش</orig>: A person licensed to perform the duties of a trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> who conducts inspections of all the debtor's business and records, or inspects specific operations or facts and submits a report thereon."
And as stipulated in Article (51) of the same law, "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may, upon a reasoned request submitted by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, a regulatory body, a creditor, the observer <orig>المراقب</orig>, the trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>, or on his own initiative, appoint an inspector <orig>مفتش</orig> from among the persons authorized to perform the duties of a trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> or from others, and assign him to inspect all of the debtor's business, assets, or dispositions, or to inspect a specific fact or facts, provided that the request to appoint the inspector <orig>مفتش</orig> pertains to a debtor for whose debts an application to initiate proceedings has been filed in accordance with the provisions of this law. In the event a trustee <orig>أمين</orig> or observer <orig>مراقب</orig> is appointed, the trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> or observer <orig>المراقب</orig>, as the case may be, shall undertake the inspection task. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall rule on the application within ten days from the date of its submission to the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>. The decision appointing the inspector <orig>مفتش</orig> shall specify the task assigned to him, his competencies, powers, and fees if he is not one of those appointed as a trustee <orig>أمين</orig> or observer <orig>مراقب</orig>. In this case, the provisions of Articles (34, 35) of this law shall apply to him. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may authorize the inspector <orig>مفتش</orig> to seek assistance from whomever he deems necessary to accomplish the assigned task. Article (49) of this law shall apply to the inspector's <orig>مفتش</orig> fees. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may require the creditor who requested the inspection to pay these fees in advance, to be recovered from the debtor's assets if the inspector <orig>مفتش</orig> concludes that the facts on which the creditor based the inspection request are valid."
And as stipulated in Article (52) thereof, "In order to carry out the assigned task, the inspector <orig>المفتش</orig> may request to hear the testimony of any person without an oath. He may also request any information or documents from the debtor, a creditor, units subject to the Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig>, persons licensed by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, regulatory bodies, or any other governmental or non-governmental entity. If the aforementioned person or entity deems that such testimony, information, or documents are not relevant to the task assigned to the inspector <orig>المفتش</orig>, they must submit a request to the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date of being notified of the inspector's <orig>المفتش</orig> request, seeking exemption from all or part of what the inspector <orig>المفتش</orig> has requested. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision on the request within ten days from the date of its submission, and his decision shall be final." And as stipulated in Article (53), "The inspector <orig>المفتش</orig> must complete the task he is assigned to carry out and submit a report to the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> detailing how it was executed and the results he reached, within the deadlines specified in the assignment decision. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may extend the execution of the task upon the inspector's <orig>المفتش</orig> request."
Guided by the foregoing, and since the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> has the authority to appoint an inspector <orig>مفتش</orig> and assign him to inspect the assets of the debtor for whose debts an application to initiate bankruptcy declaration proceedings has been filed; and as Nour Faisal Jassem Al-Narjis <orig>نور فيصل جاسم النرجس</orig>, in her capacity as one of the partners in the company against which the application was filed, has requested the appointment of an inspector <orig>مفتش</orig>, other than the appointed trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>, to review the company's books and documents to ascertain the validity of the debt subject to the restructuring request.

Therefore, we have decided:
First: To appoint the auditor, Dr. Abdulaziz Nasser Nafea Muqbil Al-Rashidi <orig>عبد العزيز ناصر نافع مقبل الرشيدي</orig>, to review the papers and documents submitted in the present application, as well as to review the papers, books, and documents of the respondent company / Al-Ma'rouf and Al-Narjis Joint General Trading Company <orig>شركة المعروف والنرجس المشتركة للتجارة العامة</orig> and its books, and to conduct an inspection of its assets, to clarify the financial position of the company, the amount of profits and losses, and who is responsible for them, if any, the fair value of the company, and whether the data provided in the restructuring application reflects the true financial position of the company. This shall be for a period of three months from the date of publication and announcement of the decision in the Official Gazette. We have authorized him, in the course of performing his mission, to seek the assistance of whomever he deems necessary to accomplish the task assigned to him, to hear the testimony of any person whose statements he deems necessary to hear without oath, and to request any information or documents from the debtor, any of the creditors, units subject to the Central Bank, persons licensed by the Authority, or other governmental or non-governmental entities, or to visit them, if necessary, and to take all necessary measures for that purpose. He is tasked with submitting a report at the end of the mission's term on how the task was executed and the results he reached. The appointed inspector's fees are set at the amount of (2000 K.D.) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, to be paid to him in advance by the applicant for the inspection, in addition to the necessary expenses incurred by the inspector, which will be disbursed to him without procedures. The applicant shall recover the fees and expenses from the funds of the respondent company if the inspector concludes that the facts on which she based her inspection request are correct.

Second: The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall publish this decision in the Official Gazette, register it in the Commercial Register, and legally notify the concerned parties of this decision.

Clerk of the Court <orig>أمين السر</orig>
Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>

# Announcement
Regarding the issuance of the decision by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> / Yousef Al-Julaibi <orig>يوسف الجليبي</orig> – dated 19/6/2025 in Application No. (2024/117) declaration of bankruptcy.
Submitted by / Al-Sultan and Khalaf Trading Company <orig>شركة السلطان وخلف التجارية</orig>.
Against / The First Kuwaiti Company for General Trading and Contracting <orig>الشركة الكويتية الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.

In the name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>
Decision

On Thursday, 19/6/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>
With the membership of Mr. / Yousef Al-Julaibi <orig>يوسف الجليبي</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. / Khalid Al-Qaisi <orig>خالد القيسي</orig>, Clerk of the Court <orig>أمين السر</orig>

In Application No.: 2024/117
Associated with Case No. 2021/6028 Commercial 3
And registered under automated No.: 243742900
After reviewing the papers:
Submitted by: Al-Sultan and Khalaf Trading Company <orig>شركة السلطان وخلف التجارية</orig>
Against: The First Kuwaiti Company for General Trading and Contracting <orig>الشركة الكويتية الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>
The facts of the case are that the applicant is a creditor to the respondent for the amount of 38,801.212 K.D. pursuant to the judgment issued in Case No. 2019/18911 Plenary Commercial 46, which ordered the respondent to pay the applicant the amount of 38,801.212 K.D. and obligated it to pay the expenses and the sum of one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> for attorney's fees. The judgment was upheld in Appeal No. 2021/6028 Commercial 3, and the judgment has become final and enforceable. An execution file was opened and the respondent company was notified, but the respondent company took no action. The applicant then requested an executory attachment of the debtor's assets held by third parties, and it became clear that the respondent company is unable to pay its debts and has ceased payment of the amount.
The applicant based her request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the respondent on Articles (14, 131) of the Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020. As the applicant submitted her aforementioned request to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, the Counselor, Head of the Bankruptcy Department, referred it to the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> to verify the conditions and data. The submitted application and its attachments were reviewed, and the applicant's representative appeared before the Department and submitted 3 document portfolios, the most important of which included a copy of Judgment No. 2019/18911 Plenary Commercial 46, a certificate of the operative part of the judgment in Appeal No. 2021/6028 Commercial 3, a statement of the execution procedures against the respondent, and a copy of an extract issued by the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig>.

In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall be considered writs of execution in accordance with this law. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall affix the executory formula to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.
<page_end>3</page_end>

</header>
and Industry for the company against which the application was filed is established, as is the imposition of an executory attachment on the company by more than one creditor, copies of the balance sheets of the company against which the application was filed for the years 2019-2020-2021-2022-2023, and a statement of all cases filed against it. The respondent company was represented by its legal counsel, who submitted a defense memorandum requesting, in its conclusion, primarily the inadmissibility of the application and, alternatively, its rejection. A portfolio of documents was submitted, which was reviewed and noted. On 12/12/2024, the Bankruptcy Committee was addressed to provide its opinion on the submitted application. The Committee's opinion was received, and it concluded that although the company is operational and has business activities, the applicant was unable to obtain its funds despite the existence of judgments and was unable to enforce them. It is also inferred that the company uses the partner's current account instead of the company's account for its business activities, so that creditors cannot collect their funds from the company, in addition to the company's failure to collect its funds, whether from accounts receivable or from the partner, and these amounts have been accumulating for a period. Therefore, we recommend the appointment of a trustee from the list of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority to inventory the debtor's assets and properties and take all necessary precautionary measures to ensure the debtor's ability to manage its business, with the trustee's mission being as follows: 1- Verifying the accounts receivable and the reason for not collecting these amounts, and whether there is any doubt about their collection. 2- Verifying the accuracy of the cash reported in the balance sheet and how the company's business is managed. 3- Verifying the partner's current account, the reason for the existence of this large amount in the account, how it was formed, and the reason for its non-payment to the company, provided that he submits his report within one month of his appointment or the period deemed appropriate by the judge. The trustee's fees were estimated at 100 hours for a total amount of KWD 5,000, with the decision to declare bankruptcy to be reconsidered after reviewing the trustee's report. - The Committee proposes taking an urgent precautionary measure by placing restrictions on the managing partner, Wadih Michel Al-Absi <orig>وديع ميشال العبسي</orig> (as a related party to the debtor company), in disposing of his funds, due to the company's use of the partner's current account instead of the company's account for its business activities. Whereas, on 2/6/2025, the bankruptcy judge issued a decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures for Al-Kuwaitiya Al-Oula for General Trading and Contracting W.L.L. <orig>الشركة الكويتية الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig>, setting 19/12/2021 as a provisional date for the cessation of payments, and to publish and announce the decision in the Official Gazette, and to notify the concerned parties thereof.

Second: The appointment of Mr. Faleh Al-Azmi <orig>فالح العازمي</orig> as the trustee of the bankruptcy, with his fees estimated at a total amount of five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> from the date of this decision until the closure of the bankruptcy. He is to inventory the debtor company's assets and properties, take all necessary precautionary measures, and prepare a list of debts and a plan for liquidation and distribution. Whereas, after the issuance of the decision, the respondent company was represented by its legal counsel, accompanied by the company's director, Wadih Michel Al-Absi <orig>وديع ميشال العبسي</orig>, who presented proof of full payment of the claimed amount. He submitted a photocopy of check number 661696 drawn on Gulf Bank dated 16/6/2025, and a photocopy of the check deposit receipt in execution file No. 19399885 Al-Asimah dated 18/6/2025 for the full claimed amount, and undertook to pay the trustee's fees. Whereas, as Article (1) of the Bankruptcy Law defines bankruptcy as (procedures aimed at the collective settlement of a debtor's debts towards their creditors through the liquidation of their assets and business and the distribution of the liquidation proceeds to their creditors, all in accordance with the provisions of the law.) And Article 9 of the Law stipulates (The Bankruptcy Department shall have jurisdiction over the following: 1- Receiving and registering applications submitted in accordance with the provisions of this law....). And Article 131 of the same law stipulates (Without prejudice to the provisions of this law regarding the application to initiate proceedings, as well as the cases specified in the chapter on preventive settlement and the chapter on restructuring, in which the bankruptcy judge may issue a decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration proceedings, the bankruptcy judge shall issue his decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration proceedings if the following conditions are met:

1- The debtor has ceased payments.
2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position.
3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuation).

Based on the foregoing, since it is established that the basis of the applicant's claim is that he is a creditor to the company sought to be declared bankrupt for the claimed amount by virtue of a judgment issued by the Commercial Circuit, and the Bankruptcy Department had addressed the Bankruptcy Committee, which concluded that the debtor company is operational and has business activities, and the legal counsel of the respondent company and its director appeared and confirmed the payment of the debt amount subject to the bankruptcy application filed against it, presenting the check deposit receipt in execution file No. 19399885 Al-Asimah dated 18/6/2025, the matter: which renders the debtor not to have ceased payments, thereby failing to meet one of the legally prescribed conditions, and the application is worthy of rejection. As for the costs of the application, the applicant shall be liable for them in accordance with Article Seven of Ministerial Resolution No. 81 of 2021 issuing the Executive Regulations of Law No. 71 of 2020 issuing the Bankruptcy Law.

**For these reasons**

We have decided:
1- To reverse our previous decision issued on 2/6/2025 to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures for Al-Kuwaitiya Al-Oula for General Trading and Contracting W.L.L. <orig>الشركة الكويتية الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig>.
2- To reject the application, with notification of this decision to the applicant and the respondent, and to record it in the electronic register at the Bankruptcy Department, while obligating the applicant to bear the costs.

Clerk of the Court
Bankruptcy Judge

In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, decisions issued by the bankruptcy judge shall be considered executory instruments under this law. The Bankruptcy Department shall affix the executory formula to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.

# Announcement
Regarding the issuance of the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge / Zaid Al-Attar <orig>زيد العطار</orig> - dated 15/6/2024 in Petition No. (140/2023) - Declaration of Bankruptcy - submitted by / Mada Communications <orig>مدى للاتصالات</orig> against / The National Company for Infrastructure Projects Development <orig>الشركة الوطنية لتطوير مشروعات البنية التحتية</orig>

In the name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The Court of First Instance

## Decision
On Sunday, 15/6/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Administration, with the membership of Mr. / Zaid Abdul Hadi Al-Attar <orig>زيد عبد الهادي العطار</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge, and in the presence of Mr. / Khalid Abdullah Al-Qaisi <orig>خالد عبدالله القيسي</orig>, Secretary, in Petition No. (140/2023 Declaration of Bankruptcy), registered under automated number: 232490310, submitted by: Mada Communications Company <orig>شركة مدى للاتصالات</orig> against: The National Company for Infrastructure Projects Development <orig>الشركة الوطنية لتطوير مشروعات البنية التحتية</orig>

After reviewing the documents and the Trustee's <orig>الأمين</orig> letter dated 3/6/2025, requesting permission to open a special bank account in the name of the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig> to collect the financial amounts received for its benefit, and in accordance with the provisions of the Bankruptcy Law and its executive regulations:

And whereas Article (44) of the Bankruptcy Law stipulates that "The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> must deposit any amount received within the proceedings into a special account at the bank designated by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> within a period not exceeding ten days from the date of its receipt, and must submit to the Bankruptcy Administration a statement of account for those amounts within ten days from the date of deposit or within any other period specified by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>. If the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> delays depositing any amounts received for the purpose of deposit without an acceptable justification, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may compel him to pay a late penalty at a rate of 7% annually on the value of the amounts not deposited, and this penalty shall be deposited into the account referred to in the preceding paragraph and shall become part of the general guarantee for creditors. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> may, in the case referred to in the preceding paragraph, replace the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig>."

In light of the foregoing, and as the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> has requested permission to open an account in the name of the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig> to collect the financial amounts received for its benefit, and since the Bankruptcy Law has obligated the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> to deposit any amount received within the proceedings into a special account at the bank designated by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> within a period not exceeding ten days from its receipt, it has been decided to grant the Trustee's <orig>الأمين</orig> aforementioned request.

## Therefore, We Have Decided:
The Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> is authorized to open a bank account in the name of the bankruptcy estate <orig>التفليسة</orig> of / The National Company for Infrastructure Projects Development <orig>الشركة الوطنية لتطوير مشروعات البنية التحتية</orig>, into which the amounts received within the proceedings shall be deposited within ten days of their receipt, provided that a monthly statement of account for those amounts is submitted to the Bankruptcy Administration, and the Bankruptcy Administration shall provide the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> with a certified copy of this decision, publish it in the Official Gazette, register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and legally notify the concerned parties.

Secretary <orig>أمين السر</orig>
Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>

In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, the decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall be considered writs of execution in accordance with this law, and the Bankruptcy Administration shall affix the executory formula to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>

## Administrative Decision No. (22) of 2025 Regarding the Cancellation of the License for the Electronic Media Outlet Named (Qiyadi)

The Assistant Undersecretary for the Press, Publishing, and Publications Sector <orig>وكيل الوزارة المساعد لشؤون قطاع الصحافة والنشر والمطبوعات</orig>:
Having reviewed the following,
- Law No. (8) of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media.
- Ministerial Decision No. (100) of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. 8 of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media.
- Administrative Decision No. 655 of 2022 regarding the delegation of certain powers.
- Electronic Media License No. 2021/492 issued on 31/10/2021.
- The request submitted by the license holder on 10/6/2025,
- Letter from the Director of the Electronic Publishing Department No. 73 dated 11/6/2025.
- And in accordance with the public interest.

**Has decided**

### (Article One)

License No. 2021/492 for the media outlet "Qiyadi" is hereby canceled by law, based on the request of the license holder, in implementation of the last paragraph of clause (8) of Article (16) of the aforementioned Law No. (8) of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media.

### (Article Two)

The concerned parties shall be notified of this decision, and it shall be published on the Ministry's website and in the Official Gazette.

**Assistant Undersecretary for the Press, Publishing, and Publications Sector**

Issued on: 26 Dhu al-Hijjah 1446 H
Corresponding to: 22 June 2025 AD

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (107) of 2025
### Regarding
### A private marketing license for a collective investment scheme established outside the State of Kuwait, granted to Boubyan Capital Investment Company for marketing the shares of Boubyan Islamic Leasing and Finance (Fund 12) (USD) Ltd Company

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments;
- And the Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association of Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>, and the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, InterVest LP <orig>إنترڤست إل بي</orig>, and the marketing manager, Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- And upon the request of Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to conduct the private marketing of the shares of Boubyan Islamic Leasing and Finance (Fund 12) (USD) Ltd Company <orig>شركة صندوق بوبيان للإجارة والتمويل الإسلامي الثاني عشر بالدولار الأمريكي المحدود</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>, issued on 12/01/2025.

The following has been decided:
### Article One
Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 12,500,000 shares (only twelve million five hundred thousand shares) of BOUBYAN ISLAMIC LEASING AND FINANCE (FUND 12) (USD) LTD COMPANY <orig>شركة صندوق بوبيان للإجارة والتمويل الإسلامي الثاني عشر بالدولار الأمريكي المحدود</orig> within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is established in the Cayman Islands <orig>جزر الكايمان</orig>. The offer price shall be 10 US Dollars (only ten US Dollars) per share, in addition to a subscription fee of 2.25% payable once upon subscription.

## Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait shall be offered to professional clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Bylaws of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its amendments. The entities receiving subscription applications are:
- Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>.
- Boubyan Bank <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig>.

## Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on the information provided in the prospectus.

## Article Four
The term of the marketing license is one year, renewable annually, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

## Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

## Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its own jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Flaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

## ACICO Industries Company <orig>شركة أسيكو للصناعات</orig> (K.S.C.) Public
### Minutes of the Adjourned Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting for the Fiscal Year Ended 31/12/2024
On Thursday, 29/5/2025 G, at 11:00 AM, at the factory headquarters of a subsidiary company (ACICO Industrial for Prefabricated Buildings and Constructions), Sulaibiya Industrial Area, Block 1, Plot 8, the Adjourned Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of ACICO Industries Company <orig>شركة أسيكو للصناعات</orig> (K.S.C.) Public was held. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Emad Abdullah Al-Essa <orig>عماد عبد الله العيسى</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors, and was attended by:
- Mr. Khaled Abdullah Al-Omari <orig>خالد عبدالله العمري</orig>, representing the Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.
- Shareholders holding 183,507,157 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 55.530% of the company's total shares of 333,400,095.
After announcing that the legal quorum for the validity of the Adjourned Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was met, the Chairman opened the meeting, welcomed the attendees, and then proceeded to present the items on the agenda as follows:
First: Approval was granted to amend Article (11) of the company's Articles of Association
- Text before amendment:
"Each share entitles its owner to a share equal to that of others without distinction in the ownership of the company's assets and in the profits distributed as hereinafter set forth."
- Text after amendment:
"Each share entitles its owner to a share equal to that of others without distinction in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits. However, the company may issue preferred shares, whereby some or all advantages may be granted to certain types of issued shares and to additional shares, with respect to voting, profits, liquidation proceeds, priority in payment of profits and capital, redemption of preferred shares, conversion rights, participation in surplus assets resulting from liquidation, or all of the foregoing combined, or otherwise, provided that shares of the same class are equal in rights, privileges, or restrictions. The rights, privileges, or restrictions related to a class of shares may not be amended except by a resolution of the Extraordinary General Assembly and the approval of two-thirds of the holders of the class of shares to which the amendment relates."

According to the following voting percentages:
<table_caption>Voting Results on Amending Article (11)</table_caption>
<table>
| Agree | Disagree | Abstain |
|:---|:---|:---|
| 90.7% | 3.9% | 5.4% |
</table>
<page_end>12</page_end>

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الاعلام</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الاعلام</orig> announces Tender No. W.A./921 for the year 2025-2026 regarding the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of solar panels at the Broadcasting Building in the Information Complex. This is in accordance with the technical terms and specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be purchased from the Ministry of Information's website via the QR code attached to this announcement, starting from Sunday, 29/6/2025, for a non-refundable fee of KWD 30/- (thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only). Bids shall be submitted to the Procurement Department at the Ministry of Information in sealed envelopes, accompanied by a preliminary bid bond of two percent (2%) of the bid value (which must be valid for the entire 90-day bid validity period). The tender number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside of the envelope, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 17/7/2025.
- The Ministry will hold a preliminary meeting on Monday, 7/7/2025, at 11:00 AM in the office of the Assistant Undersecretary for Engineering Affairs – Information Complex – Al-Soor Street – Ground Floor, to answer inquiries regarding the tender. Anyone who has purchased the tender documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. All proceedings of the meeting shall be considered an integral part of the tender documents and shall be binding on all bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all bidders before the bid closing date.
- All documents must be submitted on three (3) non-rewritable CDs, with the exception of the Bid Form, the preliminary bid bond, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the Bidder's Information Form.
- The tender is indivisible, and alternative bids will not be accepted.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend the bid-opening session, following coordination with the Procurement Department before the scheduled date for the bid-opening session.
- A valid certificate of national labor percentage compliance, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid. Please note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the bidder's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 regarding labor in the private sector. Please note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing the documents, in accordance with the provisions of Article 39 of Law No. 74 of 2019 concerning amendments to Law No. 49 of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to participate in the tender must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is an integral part of the tender documents.
- To obtain a copy, the bidder must register and pay the fees through the website: https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase/

## Announcement
The owners of the company / Electa for Electronic and Electrical Appliances ## Company Under Liquidation.
have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships at the Ministry to carry out the dissolution and liquidation of the company. Legal Entity: Limited Liability Company.
Anyone with an objection is requested to file it with the Court of First Instance within thirty days from the date of this announcement's publication, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The filing of an objection will result in the continued liability of the joint partners (in the case of a general or simple limited partnership only) towards this creditor until the objection is decided by a final judgment.

The Swiss Arab Holding Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>الشركة السويسرية العربية القابضة ( ش.م.ك.م)</orig>
Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was held at the headquarters of The Swiss Arab Holding Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>الشركة السويسرية العربية القابضة ( ش.م.ك.م)</orig> – Kuwait City – Fahad Al-Salem Street – Al-Joun Tower, 26th Floor – at 12:30 PM on Tuesday, 20/5/2025
In the presence of:
Mr. Waleed Mishari Al-Hamad <orig>وليد مشاري الحمد</orig>, member of the company's Board of Directors and authorized by the Board of Directors to chair the General Assembly.
And Mr. Mohammed Fathi Hassan Mohammed <orig>محمد فتحي حسن محمد</orig> from the office of United Accountants, the auditor, authorized by Mrs. Muneera Abdul Latif Abdullah Al-Majed <orig>منيرة عبد اللطيف عبد الله الماجد</orig>.
And Mr. Nasser Saud Al-Manea <orig>ناصر سعود المنيع</orig> from the Gulf Clearing Company.
And Mrs. Maha Mahmoud Al-Helou <orig>مها محمود الحلو</orig>, the secretary.
The meeting was convened with the following attendance quorum:

<table_caption>Share Distribution Details</table_caption>
<table>
| Proxy Shares | 19,235,843 shares |
|:---:|:---:|
| Original Shares | 122,233 shares |
</table>

Totaling 19,358,076 shares of the capital, with an attendance percentage of 92.1813%.
After the legal quorum for convening the Extraordinary General Assembly was met, the meeting began. Mr. Waleed Al-Hamad <orig>وليد الحمد</orig> welcomed the attendees, after which the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly, previously distributed to the shareholders, was discussed. Following the discussion, the following was decided:
It was approved to dissolve and amicably liquidate the company and to appoint Mr. Waleed Mishari Al-Hamad <orig>وليد مشاري الحمد</orig> as the company's liquidator, with the liquidation period to be one year from the date of annotation of the Extraordinary General Assembly in the Commercial Registry.
**Subject to the approval of the competent authorities
Chairman of the Assembly

# Al-Rabie for Tourism and Hotels Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة الربيع للسياحة والفنادق (ش.م.ك.م)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
On Monday, 16/6/2025, at 11:00 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Al-Rabie for Tourism and Hotels Company <orig>شركة الربيع للسياحة والفنادق</orig> was held in Al-Salmiya <orig>بالسالميه</orig> – Block 4 – Khalid Issa Al-Saleh <orig>خالد عيسى الصالح</orig> Building, to consider the attached agenda for the amendment of Article 17 of the company's Articles of Association. The meeting was attended by shareholders representing 7,738,063 shares, with an attendance rate of 77.3806% of the total number of shares, which is 10,000,000 shares. Also in attendance was Mr. Shuaib Abdullah Shuaib <orig>شعيب عبدالله شعيب</orig>, representing Al-Bazie & Partners <orig>البزيع وشركاهم</orig>, the company's auditors. Mr. Mohammed Bandar Al-Halwas <orig>محمد بندر الحلواص</orig> from the Gulf Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الاوراق الماليه</orig> attended via video conference. The session was opened by Mr. Mohammed Khalid Issa Al-Saleh <orig>محمدخالد عيسى الصالح</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors – Chairman of the session, who welcomed the attendees. The following took place:
1. The amendment of Article 17 of the Articles of Association was approved.
**Text of Article 17 before amendment**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of this Board may not be a merchant in a trade similar or competitive to the company's trade. Nor may he have a direct or indirect interest in the contracts and deals concluded with or for the account of the company, or have an interest that conflicts with the company's interests, unless any of this is by special license from the General Assembly. None of these members may participate in the management of a company similar or competitive to their company. The Chairman of the Board or any of its members, even if representing a legal entity, may not exploit the information that has come to them by virtue of their position to obtain a benefit for themselves or for others. Nor may they sell or buy the company's shares during their term of membership.
**Text of Article 17 after amendment**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of this Board may not be a merchant in a trade similar or competitive to the company's trade. Nor may he have a direct or indirect interest in the contracts and deals concluded with or for the account of the company, or have an interest that conflicts with the company's interests, unless any of this is by special license from the General Assembly. None of these members may participate in the management of a company similar or competitive to their company. The Chairman of the Board or any of its members, even if representing a legal entity, may not exploit the information that has come to them by virtue of their position to obtain a benefit for themselves or for others. Nor may they sell or buy his shares during their term of membership.
* The meeting concluded at 11:30 AM after Mr. Mohammed Khalid Issa Al-Saleh <orig>محمد خالد عيسى الصالح</orig>, Chairman of the Assembly (Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors – Chief Executive Officer), thanked the attendees.

# Kuwait Islamic Takaful Insurance Company K.S.C.C. <orig>شركة الكويت الإسلامية للتأمين التكافلي ش.م.ك.م</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of the shareholders of Kuwait Islamic Takaful Insurance Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة الكويت الإسلامية للتأمين التكافلي (ش.م.ك.م)</orig> was held at 11:00 AM on Tuesday, 17/06/2025, at the company's headquarters located in Awtad Tower <orig>برج أوتاد</orig> in Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> – Block 1 – Ali Al-Salem Street <orig>شارع علي السالم</orig>.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Ahmed Sami Sharif <orig>أحمد سامي شريف</orig> (Chairman of the Board of Directors). After the shareholder attendance was determined to be (88.007%) of the company's capital, the Chairman of the General Assembly announced that the legal quorum was met and the Extraordinary General Assembly was validly convened. The Chairman of the Board of Directors opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees and then proceeded to discuss the items on the agenda, and the following resolutions were passed:
**First: Approval to amend Article [15] of the Articles of Association as follows:**
**Text before amendment:**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (5) (five members). The entity entitled to appoint representatives to the Board of Directors shall appoint them in proportion to its shareholding in the company, and the General Assembly shall elect the remaining members by secret ballot.
**Text after amendment:**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (5) (five members). The entity entitled to appoint representatives to the Board of Directors shall appoint them in proportion to its shareholding in the company, and the General Assembly shall elect the remaining members by secret ballot, provided that the Board of Directors includes one or more independent members with experience and competence, selected by the Ordinary General Assembly, whose remuneration shall be determined in accordance with the rules of governance, provided that their number does not exceed half of the Board members. It is not required for an independent member to be a shareholder in the company.
The session concluded its work at 11:30 AM after discussing and making the appropriate decisions regarding the topics listed on the agenda.

### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Monday, 16/06/2025, at 11:00 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Tawazun Holding Company (K.S.C.C – Holding) <orig>شركة توازن القابضة (ش.م.ك.م – قابضة)</orig> held its meeting at the headquarters of A'ayan Leasing and Investment Company <orig>شركة أعيان للإجارة والاستثمار</orig>, located in the Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area, Mohammed bin Al-Qasim Street, First Floor.

The meeting was also attended by:
Shareholders holding 456,017,350 shares, representing 78.44% of the company's total shares of 581,326,880 shares.
After announcing the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees, then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly. The Extraordinary General Assembly reviewed the meeting's agenda items as follows:

**Item (1):**
The recommendation of the Board of Directors to reduce the company's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital from KWD 58,132,688 (only fifty-eight million, one hundred thirty-two thousand, six hundred and eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 54,932,688 (only fifty-four million, nine hundred thirty-two thousand, six hundred and eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), in the amount of KWD 3,200,000 (only three million, two hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), due to a surplus to requirements, and to distribute it to the shareholders registered in the company's records as of the date of the General Assembly meeting, each according to their percentage of the capital, was approved.

**Item (2):**
The amendment of the text of Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (5) of the Articles of Association related to the company's capital was approved.
Text of the article before amendment:
"The company's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital is set at KWD 58,132,688 (only fifty-eight million, one hundred thirty-two thousand, six hundred and eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) divided into 581,326,880 shares (only five hundred eighty-one million, three hundred twenty-six thousand, eight hundred and eighty shares), with a value of 100 fils per share, and all shares are in cash.

## Janah for Aircraft and Engine Maintenance Company (K.S.C) Closed <orig>شركة جناح لصيانة الطائرات ومحركاتها (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Thursday, 12/06/2025, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Janah for Aircraft and Engine Maintenance Company <orig>شركة جناح لصيانة الطائرات ومحركاتها</orig> was held at the company's headquarters, in the presence of Sheikh/ Rakan Nayef Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ/ راكان نايف جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, and Engineer/ Khaled Mohammed Nasser Al-Otaibi <orig>المهندس / خالد محمد ناصر العتيبي</orig>, acting on his own behalf and on behalf of the other shareholders, and the session's representative for the Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>, Mr. Mohammed Bandar Al-Hawas <orig>محمد بندر الحواس</orig>.
The quorum was complete with 100% attendance. This was to consider the following:
To consider the future of the company.
The attendees discussed the future of the company during the upcoming period, after reviewing the reports and directives of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> and after reviewing what has been done during the past period to obtain a license to practice maintenance activities from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>هيئة الطيران المدني</orig>. A temporary license, renewable every six months, has been obtained, and we are awaiting the allocation of a site within the airport grounds for construction, followed by an audit of the built facility by the Civil Aviation authority and its accreditation so that we can practice maintenance activities. Regarding the company's plans for the next phase, the company's management expects the following:
1- To begin training courses for recent Kuwaiti student graduates in the field of maintenance.
2- To contract with international maintenance companies.
3- The company is in the process of obtaining agencies for consumer goods in the field of aircraft maintenance.
4- That the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>هيئة الطيران المدني</orig> will allocate the land for the establishment of an aircraft maintenance workshop inside Kuwait International Airport <orig>مطار الكويت الدولي</orig> according to the Authority's conditions.
5- The entire issued capital will be called up after the allocation and receipt of the land for the maintenance workshop from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>هيئة الطيران المدني</orig>.
6- After the completion of the operational license, new strategic and financial partners will be brought in.
In view of the foregoing, the members of the Board of Directors agreed to continue operations to carry out the company's activities despite the high losses and resulting risks.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

2. Approval to amend Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:-
## Text Before Amendment:
The authorized capital of the company is set at an amount of KWD 80,000,000 (eighty million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) divided into 800,000,000 shares. The issued and paid-up capital is set at an amount of KWD 65,000,000 (only sixty-five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) divided into 650,000,000 shares, with a value of 100 Kuwaiti fils per share, and all shares are in cash.

## Text After Amendment:
The authorized, issued, and paid-up capital of the company is set at an amount of KWD 65,000,000 (only sixty-five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) divided into 650,000,000 shares, with a value of 100 Kuwaiti fils per share, and all shares are in cash.

3. Amendment of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:-
## Text Before Amendment:
1- Owning, selling, purchasing, and developing real estate and land for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait, as well as managing third-party properties, all in a manner that does not violate the provisions stipulated in existing laws and the prohibition on trading in private housing plots as stipulated by these laws.
2- Owning, selling, and purchasing shares and bonds of real estate companies for the company's account only in Kuwait and abroad.
3- Preparing studies and providing consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who practice providing this service.
4- Owning and managing hotels, health clubs, and tourist facilities, and leasing and renting them.
5- Carrying out maintenance work related to buildings and properties owned by the company and by others, including maintenance work and the execution of civil, mechanical, and electrical works, elevators, and air conditioning works, in a manner that ensures the preservation and safety of the buildings.
6- Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's real estate projects, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
7- Holding real estate auctions, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
8- Owning and managing commercial markets and residential complexes.
9- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
10- Direct contribution to establishing the infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas and projects under the "Build-Operate-Transfer" (BOT) system, and managing real estate facilities under the (BOT) system.
11- Managing, operating, investing in, leasing, and renting hotels, clubs, motels, guesthouses, rest houses, parks, gardens, exhibitions, restaurants, cafeterias, residential complexes, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and shops of various grades and levels, including all original and ancillary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services thereof.
12- Owning, managing, and operating health and sports institutes.
13- Selling, purchasing, and importing all types of sports tools and equipment.
14- Managing, equipping, and utilizing sports stadiums.
15- Managing sports festivals.
16- Organizing sports camps and summer clubs.

**General Guidelines for Bidders:**
1. The tender (general) is open to bidders approved by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> to carry out the works subject of the tender.
2. It is a condition for those applying for this tender to be specialized companies/institutions (within Kuwait) in carrying out all the works subject of the tender, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year. The applying companies must have prior experience in this field and possess the capabilities and specialized, trained technical labor to execute the works subject of the tender.
3. This tender is divisible and pertains to the execution of all works subject of the tender in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and the schedule of items, numbers, quantities, and prices. The bidder is not entitled to submit alternative bids (tenders), as the tender documents do not permit the submission of alternative bids (tenders). The bidder must adhere to what is stated in the documents and records of this tender in this regard.
4. The bidder must submit with their bid a preliminary guarantee in the amount of 2% (two percent) of the bid value in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, irrevocable, and reservation-free letter of guarantee issued by one of the approved banks in the State of Kuwait in their name and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. This guarantee must be valid for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by this full guarantee will be excluded. Preliminary guarantees shall not be returned until after the passage of (90) days from the tender closing date, or when the winning bidder submits the final guarantee and signs the contract, unless the tender is canceled. The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this guarantee, and the bidder's creditors may not seize its amount.
5. The total duration of the contract is (15 months) from the date of signing the contract, during which the contractor is obligated to execute all works subject of the tender in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and the schedule of items, numbers, quantities, and prices, as per the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the tender documents.
6. The bid shall remain in effect and irrevocable from the time of its submission for a period of (90 days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes. No price adjustments will be considered after the bid has been submitted. If it is not possible to decide on the bids within the specified validity period, bidders will be asked to accept the extension of their bids' validity for another similar period at most. Each bidder must agree in writing to the extension, specifying the duration of the preliminary guarantee. The bid of anyone who does not accept the extension of its validity period will be excluded.
7. If, upon studying the tender, the bidder finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or the bill of quantities that may affect the categories of their bid or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries if they are serious and will answer them during the preliminary meeting, correcting any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), or will circulate the clarification and response in a letter addressed to every bidder who purchased the tender documents. The response in this case shall be considered an integral part of those tender documents. In all cases, this shall not result in any additional responsibility or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
8. Bids shall be deposited in the designated box at the headquarters of the Supplies and Warehousing Department

# Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig>
## Announcement
Public Tender No.: M.F.A: 5/2025-2026
Air Freight for Diplomatic Missions Abroad

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> announces its need to issue a tender for Air Freight for Diplomatic Missions Abroad, according to the general and special conditions and technical specifications outlined in the tender documents. Specialized companies wishing to participate in the tender are requested to visit the Purchases and Covenants Control Department at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs building – Arabian Gulf Street, to obtain the tender documents during official working hours from (10:00 AM to 1:00 PM) for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>), seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, in cash. The tender documents must be purchased during the period from Sunday, 29/06/2025, to Thursday, 10/07/2025, with the inclusion of the following documents:
1- An authorization letter from the company to purchase the tender in the person's name, along with a copy of their civil ID.
2- Payment of the prescribed fees for purchasing the tender documents via Knet.
3- A copy of the Commercial Register.
4- A copy of a recent certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
5- A copy of a recent registration receipt from the Central Agency for Public Tenders.
6- The company must be specialized in this field.
7- Annual labor percentage certificate.
In addition to any conditions the competent authority may deem appropriate. Please note that the preliminary meeting for the tender will be held on Monday, 07/07/2025, at 11:00 AM at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs building – Arabian Gulf Street. The deadline for submitting and closing bids is Thursday, 10/07/2025, from 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after this time will be accepted.
Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of bid opening. The value of the initial guarantee is (3000) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, and it must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity (note that the tender is indivisible).
This is for your information.
For inquiries, please contact Mr. Mohammed Abathraa <orig>محمد اباذراع</orig> 7731 –

## Announcement of the Sale of Seized Items by Public Auction
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> – Capital Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة تنفيذ العاصمة</orig> announces that on Wednesday, 16/07/2025, starting at 10:30 AM, seized items will be sold by public auction in the Amghara Industrial Area <orig>منطقة أمغرة الصناعية</orig> – Block 2 – Kibar Al-Muqawilin Street – Plot 268, Automated Plot Number (93837634). The seized items are owned by the defendant, Al-Alamia for Buildings Company <orig>الشركة العالمية للمباني</orig>, and are detailed in the executive seizure report dated 16/06/2025, in file No. 112297080. The seizure was made in favor of the seizing party, the Electrical Contracting Company <orig>شركة المقاولات الكهربائية</orig>, in settlement of the amount of (1,511,429.711) K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig>.
Those wishing to purchase should be present at the time and place specified above. Anyone wishing to review further details should contact the Compulsory Enforcement Section <orig>قسم التنفيذ الجبري</orig> – Enforcement Department during official working hours. This is announced for public information.
Head of the Capital Enforcement Department

2) The property subject of the lawsuit is the Arjan Al-Bidaa Resort (formerly Al-Rimal), which is located directly on the sea, bordered from the back by Al-Taawun Street, on the east by the Mövenpick Resort, and on the west by a walled property.
3) The expert committee inspected the resort buildings and found the following:
- Buildings No. (1), (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), and (7) are hotel apartment buildings.
- Building No. (8) is the main building, hotel entrance, administrative offices, main kitchen, as well as hotel apartments.
- Buildings No. (9) and (10), currently Building (13), is a building consisting of a ground and first floor containing (12) commercial shops.
- Building No. (11) is a commercial building consisting of a (Nike) store and two restaurants.
- Building No. (12) is located directly on the sea and was undergoing renovation works at the time of inspection, as well as construction of a swimming pool in front of the building's facade.
- Building No. (14) is fully utilized as a beauty salon and commercial showroom under the name (Rasha Chic).
- There is a swimming pool in the middle of the resort.
- Buildings No. (11), (13), and (14) are located at the rear of the resort, opposite Al-Taawun Street, and are separated from the hotel apartment buildings and the administrative building No. (8) by an entrance to the basement car park.
4) The components of the hotel apartment buildings are consistent with what is stated in the real estate report issued by the World Bank, submitted in the case file of the eighth and ninth defendants at the session of 20/9/2021, document (7).
5) The appointed expert inspected the property subject of the lawsuit and reviewed the case file and its documents to submit his report.
There is an investment contract dated 22/10/2017, concluded between the First Party / the heirs of the late Sheikh <orig>الشيخ</orig> / Saad Al-Abdullah Al-Salem Al-Sabah <orig>سعد العبدالله السالم الصباح</orig>, and the Second Party / Argana Hotels and Resorts Company (formerly the Kuwait International Institute for Sports and Health Company), under which the Second Party leased two plots of land:
- Plot (5), Block (13) of Plan M/38640, Rumaithiya Coastal Strip (Rimal Hotel and Resort) with an area of 22,202.1 m2. (The subject of the dispute)
- Plot (7), Block (13) of Plan M/38640, Rumaithiya Coastal Strip (Mövenpick Hotel and Resort) with an area of 30,833.1 m2.
During the term of the contract, the Second Party, at its own expense, utilized the two plots of land to establish a tourist resort that includes hotels, facilities, and commercial projects worth several million, requiring its continued presence on the leased land beyond the expiry date of the current lease agreement, which is valid until 31/12/2023. The parties have the right to conclude another contract before the end of the current one, to become effective from 1/1/2024 for a period of 25 years. The third clause stipulated that the annual rental value for the two plots of land is KWD 2,250,000 (two million, two hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), to be increased every six years as detailed in the aforementioned third clause of the contract.

From the foregoing detailed statement, it became clear to the committee that the property subject of the lawsuit is the Arjan Al-Bidaa Resort (formerly Al-Rimal) and that the possessor of the property is Argana Hotels and Resorts Company, the ninth defendant, which has the right of usufruct under the aforementioned investment contract, and it is operated as a commercial-tourist resort.

Note: Pursuant to the investment contract notarized under No. 2640, Volume 3, dated 22/10/2017, and in accordance with Article Nine of the said contract, the party declares on its own behalf and in its capacity that it is not permissible to place any mortgage on the facilities established on the land, nor to create any rights thereon for third parties throughout the term of the aforementioned contract (this restriction is recorded in the seizure records).

## Observations:
- The property is a hotel resort consisting of 8 hotel apartment buildings and 4 hotel service buildings, including commercial shops. There are some violations on the seafront, including:
- New construction of a bathroom on the southern side with light materials, area 3x6m, as shown in the plan.
- New construction of a storage room with light materials, 3x4m.
- New construction of a separate aluminum and glass hall for a restaurant and cafe, area 22x10m.
- New construction of 10 air-conditioned glass and aluminum domes with a diameter of 3.70m.
- Construction of a room for preparing coffee orders from light materials with a diameter of 3m.
- Construction of a separate room for renting boats, area 4x5m, on the northern side.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin with a base price of KWD 39,117,600 (thirty-nine million, one hundred seventeen thousand, and six hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of this price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at his own risk in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award will be ruled in his favor, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at his own risk based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, and the Clerk's Office of the Court of First Instance shall bear no liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law stipulates that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a rent equivalent to the market rate."

President of the Court of First Instance

**First: Property Description According to the Attached Description Certificate:**
Property under Document No. 1290/2023, located in the Al-Qurain <orig>القرين</orig> area, Block 6, Plot 215, Plan M/36942, with an area of 400 m², to be sold at public auction with a base price of (385,000 K.D.) three hundred eighty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

**\*\* As stated in the description certificate:**
The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor + roof. Violations were found, consisting of a light-material canopy on the first floor at the rear, an unlicensed elevator built on the ground, first, second, and roof levels, and an additional structure on the first and second floors on the service road side (the yard). A violation report No. 24881 was issued.

**\*\* According to the expert's report:**
On 5/2/2024, the expert proceeded to inspect the property subject of the lawsuit, located in the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area, Block 6, Street 7, Plot No. 215, House 6, with PACI No. 13255387. This was done in the presence and under the guidance of the plaintiffs' agent and the first defendant himself. The appraisal expert, retained by the Administration, was also present to inspect the property in preparation for estimating its value. After examination and inspection, the expert found the following:

**General Description of the Disputed Property**
The property subject of the lawsuit is located in the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area, Block 6, Street 7, House No. 6, Plot No. 215, with PACI No. 13255387. The property is situated on a single street and has a setback with parking for 3 cars. It also has an island in front of the property belonging to it, with parking for 2 cars. The exterior cladding of the disputed property is beige Sigma paint. The property consists of a ground floor, first floor, and roof, and has 2 main iron entrances.

**Specific Description of the Disputed Property**
Under the guidance of the first defendant, the expert inspected the interior of the property. The ground floor consists of a hall, a bathroom attached to the hall, a room, a kitchen, an annex, and a bathroom attached to the annex. The outer yard consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, a bathroom for the diwaniya, a maid's room, and a storage room. The first floor has 4 rooms, two halls, a kitchen, and 3 bathrooms. The roof consists of a kitchen, a hall, two rooms, and a bathroom. The property subject of the lawsuit conforms to the document submitted to the expert. The appraisal expert recorded the general and specific descriptions of the property in preparation for estimating its value.

**Second: Auction Conditions:**
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.

Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.

Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.

Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their liability, based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures. The Clerk's Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> shall bear no liability.

Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to execute a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Announcement of a Sealed-Envelope Auction Sale
### Auction No. (2478)

The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> announces the sale of office furniture, water coolers, refrigerators, and televisions by sealed-envelope auction at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, according to the following details:
1- Location for receiving the booklet of conditions and participation offer for the auction: Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> – Central Archives and Files Section – Financial Affairs, from 29/6/2025 until 3/7/2025. The documents will be provided for a non-refundable fee of (25) K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> to be paid via K-net at the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> cashier.
The bidder will sign an acknowledgment and pledge upon receiving the booklet of conditions to adhere to the specified appointment for submitting the offer to the Central Sales Committee at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>.
2- Inspection Date: (5) working days from 29/6/2025–3/7/2025. Inspection Time: During official working hours.
Reception location for those wishing to inspect the auction items: Al-Ahmadi Health Region <orig>منطقة الأحمدي الصحية</orig>.
3- Date for Submission of Bids and Opening of Envelopes:
- Submission of bids on Tuesday, 8/7/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department <orig>إدارة شؤون التخزين العامة</orig> – Central Sales Section <orig>قسم البيع المركزي</orig>, according to the appointment set for the bidder by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (no bid will be accepted after the bidder's specified appointment time has passed).
- Opening of envelopes and holding of the auction on Wednesday, 9/7/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department <orig>إدارة شؤون التخزين العامة</orig>.
- The winning bidder will be announced on the Ministry of Finance's <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> website on Wednesday, 9/7/2025.
- Checks of unsuccessful bidders will be returned on Thursday, 10/7/2025.
- The certified check / bank guarantee must be submitted in the name of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
- Special Conditions for the Auction:
1. The bidder must be a Kuwaiti citizen – individual or company – registered in the Commercial Register and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>. A foreigner may participate provided they have a Kuwaiti partner or agent who is a merchant under a notarized contract. (Must attach: a copy of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry certificate, a copy of the company license, a copy of the Civil ID, and an authorized letter of delegation from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, all of which must be valid).
2. Kuwaiti individuals are permitted to participate in the auction (a copy of the Civil ID must be attached).
To receive the auction's booklet of conditions: Please contact Ms. Zainab Agha <orig>زينب آغا</orig>, Tel: 24622342
Inspection site official: Please contact Mr. Hussein Mohammed Al-Azmi <orig>حسين محمد العازمي</orig>, Tel: 99549049
Central Sales Committee at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> / Tel: (22481971).
Website address: www.mof.gov.kw

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وكيل وزارة المالية</orig>
