# Ministry of Oil <orig>وزارة النفط</orig>
## Announcement
Tender No. 1/2025-2026
The Ministry of Oil <orig>وزارة النفط</orig> announces the following tender:
Public Tender / (Purchase of an Asset Management & Tracking System Program)
In accordance with the general and special terms and specifications contained in the documents of the aforementioned tender. The tender documents can be obtained from the Ministry of Oil <orig>وزارة النفط</orig>, Oil Sector Complex – Shuwaikh – end of Gulf Street – Third Floor – Financial Affairs Department – Disbursement and Supply Section, telephone: 24995363-24995314, during official working hours starting from Sunday, 29/6/2025, for a non-refundable fee of 75 Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> (seventy-five Dinars). The deadline for submitting bids is Thursday, 10/7/2025, at 2:00 PM, to be placed in the tender box at the Ministry of Oil <orig>وزارة النفط</orig>. Bids shall be valid for a period of 90 days from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
The preliminary guarantee for this bid is 2% and must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity. Note that this tender is indivisible.

# Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding Public Tender (A.D./T/784) for the Supply of Ink and Spare Parts for Photocopiers with Maintenance as Needed
The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the offering of Public Tender (A.D./T/784) for the supply of ink and spare parts for photocopiers with maintenance as needed. Companies or institutions specialized in this field wishing to participate should apply to obtain the terms booklet and tender documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayan Palace – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department). This can be done during official working hours starting from the date of this announcement's publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for a non-refundable fee of K.D. 75/- (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> only) for the booklet (payment via K-Net only). Small and medium-sized enterprises are exempt from this fee (upon presentation of a certificate proving such status). This is available from 8:30 AM to 1:00 PM, taking into account the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 17/7/2025. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department – Bayan Palace – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- A preliminary guarantee of K.D. 2,000/- must be submitted in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid for the entire bid validity period of (90) days.
4- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage must be submitted.
5- An authorization letter and a copy of the Civil ID of the company representative for purchasing the tender document.
6- This public tender is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The tenderer must submit a letter with an attached copy of the registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8- The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving the right to extend or renew this period for the duration(s) it deems appropriate to complete the awarding procedures.
9- The preliminary meeting is scheduled for Monday, 7/7/2025, at 10:00 AM at the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>, Bayan Palace – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department.
10- The bidder and parties to the tender and follow-up document.
For inquiries:
-Email: gt.alsaqer@da.gov.kw
-Phone: 22011435

Undersecretary for Financial, Administrative, and Personnel Affairs <orig>الوكيل للشئون المالية والإدارية والموظفين</orig>

# Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig>
## Announcement of Tender No. P.A.C.I. 1 – 2025/2026 Regarding the Purchase of Licenses for Risk Management Tool Software
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces the issuance of a tender by sealed envelope regarding the purchase of licenses for Risk Management Tool software in the booklet:
1. These documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department, Cashier Section (South Surra, Ministries Area <orig>جنوب السرة منطقة الوزارات</orig>, Ground Floor) during official working hours for a non-refundable fee of KWD 50/- (only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
2. The deadline for submitting bids to the Financial Affairs Department is 12:00 PM on Thursday, 10/7/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.
3. The initial bid bond amount must not be less than 2% (two percent) of the tender bid value. The bond must be issued in Arabic by an approved local bank and remain valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
4. The final performance bond amount is 10% (ten percent) of the total contract value, and this bond must be issued in Arabic by an approved local bank.
5. The bid shall remain valid for a period of 90 days (ninety days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
6. Alternative offers will not be accepted.
7. The tender is not divisible.

Acting Director General <orig>المدير العام بالتكليف</orig>

# Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects (KAPP) <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>
## Waterfront Property Project – Phase Three (Sharq Area in Kuwait City)
### Invitation to Bid Announcement for Public Auction No. (1/2025)
The State of Kuwait, through the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects (KAPP) <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> in cooperation with the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>, invites companies/consortiums wishing to submit bids to participate in Public Auction No. (1/2025) concerning the modernization, development, repair, major maintenance, management, operation, and periodic maintenance of the Waterfront Property Project – Phase Three – located in the Sharq area, described as the parcel designated with the number (1) with a total area of (384,385 m2) from survey plan No. M/39505, from which the area of the Shamlan plot (56,111 square meters) is excluded, in accordance with the provisions of Law No. (116) of 2014 regarding Public-Private Partnerships and its executive regulations.

### 1– Subject of the Auction
The modernization, development, repair, major maintenance, management, operation, and periodic maintenance of the Waterfront Property Project – Phase Three (Sharq area in Kuwait City <orig>منطقة شرق بمدينة الكويت</orig>). The usufruct right period will be (15) fifteen years, as stipulated in the auction documents.

Companies/Consortiums must meet the following requirements:
- Be registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> – if a local entity – or its equivalent in the country of origin for non-local entities and consortiums. Each applicant must attach the following documents to its bid:
- A copy of a valid registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> or its equivalent in the country of origin.
- A copy of the signature authorization.
- A copy of the Memorandum of Association/Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس/النظام الأساسي</orig> and subsequent amendments.
- A copy of a valid commercial license issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> or its equivalent in the country of origin.
- A copy of the audited financial statements for the last three years, including key financial ratios.
- Have at least 10 years of experience in implementing similar projects (public or private) and a track record of at least two projects of the same nature.
- The company must provide its experience over the past ten years in similar projects where the value of the works assigned to it is not less than KWD 15,000,000 (fifteen million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) per contract, with proof of completion of those works. The bidder's capital must not be less than KWD 40,000,000 (only forty million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) or its equivalent in the country of origin.
- Provide proof of its ability to meet the technical, legal, and financial requirements for the modernization, development, repair, major maintenance, management, operation, and periodic maintenance of the Waterfront Project – Phase Three in Kuwait City by completing Form No. (2) General Information, (3) Investor's Financial Solvency, and (4) Investor's Professional Experience, and attaching them to these documents.
- Be specialized in any of the following activities, or one of the consortium members must be:
  - • Land and real estate management and development (Code 682022).
  - • Management and development of third-party properties (Code 682021).
  - • Public facilities management (Code 811006).
- Provide proof that the entity – if a local company – meets the requirements of Law No. 19 of 2000 concerning the support and encouragement of national labor to work in non-governmental sectors by completing Form No. (2) General Information.
- Provide proof that the entity – if a local company – meets the requirements of Decree No. (3) of 1955 concerning Kuwaiti Income Tax, as amended by Law No. (2) of 2008, by completing Form No. (3) Investor's Financial Status.
- The company / or a company in a consortium must have participated in, completed, financed, supervised, managed, or executed, either individually or jointly, development projects involving multiple government or private buildings inside or outside Kuwait. These projects should include, but are not limited to, infrastructure, tourism, entertainment, sports, and other fields related to the nature of the project, at any stage, whether as an investor, financier, manager, or executing contractor.
- Submit a statement detailing any ongoing legal disputes with any government entity in the State of Kuwait or any government entity in the bidder's country.
- Submit a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the company's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority for any of the violations mentioned in Article (10) of Law No. (6) of 2010 concerning work in the private sector, by completing Form No. (5/B) – Certificate of No Violations (Local Companies).
- The bidder must submit letters from the banks it deals with, indicating its financial position and their willingness to grant credit facilities, by completing Form No. (3) – Investor's Financial Solvency.
- In the event that the bidder wishes to make a change – before the bid submission deadline – to any of the data included in the auction documents, it must notify the Authority in writing and obtain the Authority's approval.

## 2- Bidding Document Fees
Investors wishing to obtain the bidding documents must sign a confidentiality agreement by the legal representative <orig>الممثل القانوني</orig> / authorized signatory <orig>المفوض بالتوقيع</orig>, which can be obtained from the Authority's official website www.kapp.gov.kw, and submit it to the Authority before receiving said documents.
The Authority invites investors to obtain the bidding documents by paying a fee of KWD 7,500 (seven thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) in favor of the "Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>" through any of the following payment methods:
(a) Transfer the amount to the Authority's account number IBAN (KW07CBKU00000000000012012039), taking into consideration that the transfer amount must be net of any fees. The Authority may require confirmation of receipt of the transfer, which may take no less than three (3) business days.
(b) Submit a non-refundable certified check <orig>شيك مصدق</orig> issued by a bank licensed to operate in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in favor of the "Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>".
(c) Electronic payment service (K-net) (Visa/Mastercard are not accepted).
Regarding payment methods (b) and (c), interested parties must deliver the payment to:
Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>
Touristic Enterprises Company Building - Second Floor
Shuwaikh Administrative Area <orig>الشويخ الإدارية</orig> - Jahra Street <orig>شارع الجهراء</orig> - Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>
Phone: +965 2496 5964 / 76
Once the payment process is complete, the applicant must send proof of payment via email to Sharq@kapp.gov.kw to obtain the bidding documents. Note that the deadline for purchasing the bidding documents is September 28, 2025.
Each bid must be accompanied by a preliminary bid bond <orig>تأمين أولي</orig> in the form of a certified check <orig>شيك مصدق</orig> or an unconditional and irrevocable letter of guarantee <orig>خطاب ضمان</orig> issued by a bank licensed to operate in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in favor of the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> in the amount of KWD 250,000 (only two hundred fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

## 3- Bid Validity Period
The submitted bid must remain valid for a period of ninety (90) days from the closing date. The Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> reserves the right to request an extension or renewal of this period for a duration it deems appropriate to complete the bidding and awarding procedures.

## 4- Preference Margin
The investor whose contract has expired shall have a preference margin in the awarding of the bid if they participate in the tender with a bid that is within 5% of the best bid.

Applying companies and consortia must submit their bids in an envelope addressed as follows:
Headquarters of the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> located at: Shuwaikh Administrative Area <orig>الشويخ الإدارية</orig> - Jahra Street <orig>شارع الجهراء</orig> - Touristic Enterprises Company Building - Second Floor. The sender's name or any identifying marks or signs should not be mentioned. Torn, damaged, or distorted envelopes will not be accepted.
This envelope shall contain the following:
An envelope marked "First Envelope: Preliminary Bid Bond": The first envelope must contain Form No. (1) A or B.
An envelope marked "Second Envelope: Technical Proposal": The second envelope must contain Forms from (2) to (5/B) and the technical proposal submitted to the Authority with the bidding documents.
An envelope marked "Third Envelope: Financial Proposal": The third envelope must contain Form No. (6).
Companies and consortia must submit three (3) tightly sealed hard copies of the contents of the first, second, and third envelopes, along with three (3) electronic storage units (Flash Drive) for each envelope separately. The electronic files must be in PDF format. This must be submitted no later than 12:00 PM Kuwait time on Sunday, September 28, 2025.
For any inquiries, please contact us via email: Sharq@kapp.gov.kw
This announcement is an integral, complementary, and supplementary part of the tender documents. This announcement does not constitute any obligation on the part of the Authority in any way to proceed to the next stage or to award the tender. The Authority reserves the full right to cancel, amend, or extend the tender, or to proceed with the project in another manner without any liability on the part of the Authority or any other government entity.

# General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>
Customs Instruction No. 30 of 2025
Regarding Allowing National Companies and Factories to Export Baled Scrap
(Copper / Aluminum) and Shredded Copper

Director General of Customs <orig>مدير عام الجمارك</orig>:–
Based on Ministerial Resolution No. 33 of 2019 issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, pursuant to which Customs Instruction No. 24 of the year was issued, appended to Customs Instruction No. 42 of 2019, which stipulated a ban on the export of ground and shredded copper, cables stripped of insulation of all types, new and scrap, and that it is not permitted to be exported except in its original form without alteration and after obtaining written approval from the Ministry of Electricity and Water <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء</orig>.
And with reference to the letter from the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة والمتجددة</orig> No. 20250025002150 dated 3/6/2025, registered with us in the General Registry under incoming No. 3156 dated 4/6/2025, which states that the Ministry has no objection to allowing national (companies / factories) to export baled scrap (copper / aluminum) and shredded copper, provided that a request is submitted to the Ministry for permission to export to verify the integrity of the exported materials, as well as providing proof of ownership of the exported scrap, so that the Ministry can verify the compliance of (companies / factories) with regulations and systems.
Therefore, the esteemed Directors are requested to take note and instruct their specialists to act upon and adhere to the aforementioned instructions and conditions, effective from this date.
Director General of the General Administration of Customs <orig>مدير عام الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>
Issued on: 24 June 2025 G

A preliminary meeting will be held at the headquarters of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> on (Monday), (7/7/2025) at (eleven o'clock in the morning).

The documents shall be returned after being filled out, with the required documents attached, and a preliminary deposit of not less than (2%) of the bid value in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by an accredited bank in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and for the benefit of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this deposit will not be considered, even if they conform to the specifications. The deposit must be valid for the required bid validity period. The documents shall be submitted in an official envelope sealed with red wax, and the bids will be delivered to the (Tenders and Contracts Department <orig>قسم المناقصات والعقود</orig>) at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.

Note that the deadline for submitting bids is (one o'clock in the afternoon) on (Wednesday), (16/7/2025). Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

- The aforementioned cash consideration shall be paid by K-Net, Visa, or MasterCard.
- The company must be registered with the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> when submitting the bid.
- A preliminary deposit of not less than (2%) and not more than (5%) of the bid value must be submitted in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by an accredited bank in the State of Kuwait.
- The documents shall be returned after being filled out, with the required documents attached, in an official envelope sealed with red wax. The bids will be delivered to the Tenders and Contracts Department <orig>قسم المناقصات والعقود</orig> – Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
- The deadline for submitting bids is on Tuesday, (29/7/2025) at one o'clock in the afternoon at the headquarters of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
- The location for receiving the envelopes is the main administration building in Subhan – Ground Floor – Bid Receiving Room.

# General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig>
## Announcement regarding the Waqf <orig>وقف</orig> of Marzouq bin Gharib <orig>مرزوق بن غريب</orig>
The General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> announces that it has identified the descendants of the Waqf <orig>وقف</orig> of Marzouq bin Gharib <orig>مرزوق بن غريب</orig>. After verification and review of the supporting documents, it has been determined that the names listed below are the beneficiaries of the said Waqf <orig>وقف</orig>. Anyone with an objection should submit a written letter to the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig>, located in the Dasma area <orig>منطقة الدسمة</orig>, Private Endowments Department <orig>إدارة المصارف الخاصة</orig>, to prove their entitlement within 15 days from the date of this announcement's publication, from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM).
The necessary documents must be attached, as the Waqf <orig>وقف</orig> will be distributed to the beneficiaries.
For inquiries, Tel: 22065476

# Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>
## Tender Announcement
The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. E.M.M./1/2023/2024
Provision of internet subscription and data transmission line services at the request of the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>
Tender documents can be obtained from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

<table_caption>Tender Details</table_caption>
<table>
| Issuance | Scheduled Bid Submission Date (Closing Date) | Price | Guarantee |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 29/6/2025 | 22/7/2025 | 75 | 2000 K.D. valid for 90 days in favor of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> |
</table>

- Preliminary meeting for inquiries: 10:00 AM on Monday, 13-07-2025, at the Ministry of Public Works.
The tender documents will be published on the Agency's website for review before proceeding to purchase the documents.
The final time for submitting bids is one o'clock in the afternoon on the day specified in the announcement above for bid submission.
- Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission and deposit of bids on a CD, as found on the Agency's website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid by a certified check or K-Net card.
- Companies/bidders wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must submit them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified in the table above for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). Any inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Agency will not be considered.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, with the exception of the bid form and the preliminary guarantee, which are to be submitted as hard copies.
- Not divisible.
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the bidder's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 regarding work in the private sector. It should be noted that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid-opening session.
- Companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department beforehand.

## Announcement of Re-issuance of Practice No. (20-2024-2025)
Regarding the provision of consulting services in the field of technical support for the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig>

# Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
## Announcement 68 / 2025
Offering of Bid No. 2025/2026/2 for the license to utilize a space in the Kuwait Municipality building, Capital Governorate branch, to provide printing and photocopying services to visitors
Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces the offering of the aforementioned bid, for the license to utilize a space in the Kuwait Municipality building, Capital Governorate branch, to provide printing and photocopying services to visitors.
Those wishing to participate in this bid must visit Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> (Administrative Building – Seventh Floor – Tenders and Bids Monitoring Department) during official working hours to obtain the bid documents for a fee of K.D. 50/- (only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), which is non-refundable under any circumstances. Small and medium-sized enterprises accredited by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempt from this fee.
The bidder must conduct a due diligence inspection of the service delivery site before the date of the preliminary meeting, to enable bidders to raise their inquiries at the preliminary meeting to achieve the principle of transparency.
The preliminary meeting with bidders who have obtained the bid documents will be held at 10:00 AM on Tuesday, 7/15/2025, at the Municipality branch building in the Capital Governorate <orig>محافظة العاصمة</orig>. Companies and institutions must present the receipt for payment of the prescribed fee along with a letter from the company or institution authorizing their attendance at the preliminary meeting. All companies submitting their bids must send a representative to attend the public session for the opening of the bid envelopes, scheduled for Monday, 7/21/2025. Please note that the Municipality will not be held responsible for non-compliance with attendance.
Bids must be submitted in sealed envelopes, sealed with red wax, with the bid number and subject written on them. The bidder's name or any identifying information should not be written on the envelope. They are to be placed in the designated box at Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> (Administrative Building – Seventh Floor – Tenders and Bids Monitoring Department) no later than 12:00 PM on Monday, 7/21/2025, which is the deadline for accepting bids. A bid bond of not less than 2% (two percent) and not exceeding 5% of the bid value must be submitted with the bid.
If you wish to contact the Municipality, please make an appointment by visiting the link: www.baladia.gov.kw
On behalf of the Director General of the Municipality

The holder of the following license has applied to the Municipality:

requesting the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality for its classification.
Pursuant to Article (19) of Municipality Decision No. (161/2009) concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel their classification. The committee stipulated in the first article of these regulations may issue its decision to that effect after the following two conditions are met:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- A period of (15) fifteen days has elapsed since the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this decision.
Accordingly, the Municipality urges anyone with any claims against the aforementioned contractor for building construction contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to non-compliant contracting works or dues arising from the construction contract, to contact the Contractors Section at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the specified period.
Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

## Announcement for Companies to Address Ultrasonic Antifouling Technologies for heat exchangers

Expression of interest for participation by international companies with expertise in Ultrasonic Antifouling Technologies for heat exchangers in refineries. This study aims to evaluate and implement ultrasonic solutions to address fouling problems and improve the operational efficiency of heat exchangers using innovative ultrasonic technologies, thereby enhancing the efficiency of heat exchangers in the company's refinery operations and extending the lifespan of heat exchangers in harsh industrial environments.

- Pursuant to the text of Article (29) of Law No. 49 of 2016 regarding Public Tenders, "a single person or a group of persons collectively may not register for classification under more than one name, nor submit more than one bid in a tender, with the exception of alternative bids where the tender conditions permit their submission. However, a person who has a share in separate companies, where each company is independent in its legal personality, finances, engineers, employees, and general administrative structure, may register themselves and each of their independent companies for classification. A bid from a tenderer who violates this article shall be considered null and void by law."
